main event: A single red flare was observed at the indicated location in the Atlantic Ocean on January 6, 1957.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for only 1 minute., The observer reported seeing between 6 to 10 objects, although only one red flare was noted., The flare was reported to be at coordinates 42-06N 63-51W, 250 miles east of Boston., No additional objects were seen after the initial flare., The report was considered poor in quality.
